intro: Tricyrtis macropoda f. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy spider lily, is a hybrid form of the spider lily native to Japan. It is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soil. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is a member of the Hemerocallidaceae family. This variety is prized for its unique foliage and delicate floral display.
